subject: Change systemd install target to default.target
commitMessage:
Change systemd install target to default.target

Due to TLM integration, graphical.target is no longer
used. Move notification*.service to default.target.

Change-Id: Ief41127844282b2824274b5b435b4162d9eb9d23
Bug-Tizen: TC-2308
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

Just tried it on latest Common snapshot, works fine, the 2 services run as expected. Thanks !

+2ing, merging.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Adding a requirement to vconf-setup service

Adding a requirement to vconf-setup service

Notification service expects vconf to be ready because it
uses it and espacially, it uses the memory backend of vconf.

subject: Move display service .service install outside autotools
commitMessage:
Move display service .service install outside autotools

IVI profile needs the notification-display.service inside
systemd --user session.

To simplify the .service file install for both Common and IVI,
move it outside autotools and do it in the .spec file instead.

Change-Id: I7d31a5cfb2574b2123dbdf53c32d324049362028
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Good change ; admitted, the autotools part was redundant and inelegant. I cannot do +2 unfortunately.

Patch Set 1:

Manuel, I've granted you the permissions.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Use the new wait/send API for interactive notifications
commitMessage:
Use the new wait/send API for interactive notifications

If the notification has the EXECUTE_RESPONDING flag,
the display plugin will retrieve values from the attached
bundle to add an input textfield and multiple buttons,
and eventually send a response using the new
notification_send_response() API.

Bug-Tizen: TC-996

Change-Id: I6bc11837cc6c9fd5046f54152e1212ac948cd271
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: remove pending notifications from DB when starting notifications-display service
commitMessage:
remove pending notifications from DB when starting notifications-display service

If some notifications are present in notification.db when starting notifications-display
service, we remove them. Otherwise, wrong popups appears when starting the service.

Change-Id: Id8813a9dc420ef7b84ddcb4817484b61362a18fa
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Add an IVI-specific systemd service
commitMessage:
Add an IVI-specific systemd service

IVI does not have a systemd setup similar to Common, most
notably the Weston part. This makes starting
"notifications-display.service" on IVI fail. Fix that.
This can safely be reverted in the future.

Change-Id: I48f169082a0e12e4b778710a2a34d8a4efcbe87f
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: handle bluetooth notifications in wlmessage plugin
commitMessage:
handle bluetooth notifications in wlmessage plugin

This is a minimal implementation that treats pairing confirmation
and authorize push requests.

Change-Id: I97d95c0a961d98fdcec1ab8840a335d611181e26
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Manuel,

Can you review this implementation of bluetooth popups plz ?

With this patch I'm able to display and accept pairing request. After being paired, notifications-display service seg fault.

I set '-1' to not merge this patch for the moment.

Btw, the way to delete notification once it is treated is maybe not very good... And doesn't work for the moment either because of the segfault or because of bad use of notification API.

Patch Set 1:

Hi Corentin,

No problem ; I am on another issue right now, but I will review it ASAP.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

I made a fix in com-core and now notification-display-service doesn't segfault anymore.
https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/28296/
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Create a "notification-display-service" daemon
commitMessage:
Create a "notification-display-service" daemon

"notification-display-service" is run by a systemd unit
named "notifications-display.service" ; if we are running
under a Wayland or X11 profile, it will display new
notifications under the form of customized popup windows,
and delete them once they are validated with "Ok".
Otherwise, it will just print the messages to stderr
without deleting them.

Change-Id: Id33b01d67df4d731f666c2b145262642ca21cdbc
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>
Author: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>
Author: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

+1 with few cosmetic comments :
- there are few trailing whitespaces
- a comment could be nice when checking socket presence and so on...

Patch Set 1:

Seems this is only worthwhile if running with Wayland.

Would it make sense to throw the .service installation into a  %if %(with wayland) section?

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

See previous comment

Patch Set 1:

Hi Brad and thanks for your review,

The original spec only mentioned Wayland ; a X11 version is coming, though (https://github.com/Tarnyko/libwlmessage/commits/x11 ). It should be released in the upcoming days, and then the %with wayland/x stuff will not be necessary anymore.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

As promised, this new patch set uses the new "libwlmessage", which now supports both Wayland and X11. Reworked the code accordingly.

Patch Set 4:

Hi Corentin, and sorry for not having seen your comment before,

Yes, you are right. I just removed the trailing whitespaces, and added calls to LOGD() for each of the early checks. I hope this looks better now.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Introduce the display plugin system
commitMessage:
Introduce the display plugin system

At startup, "notification-display-service" will now search
for plugins in the "/usr/lib$ARCH/notification-service
/plugins" directory. If one is found, it will use it to
display notifications on screens. Otherwise, it will fall
back to pure text with dlog.

There is currently one plugin : wlmessage.so.

Change-Id: I663fc24ec2c9fd8c1f0a2f07be08f479f2a4569d
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

This new patch set does not use a global function pointer anymore. So code style is better.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: send-notification: do not send a notification when using "--help"
commitMessage:
send-notification: do not send a notification when using "--help"

The "--help" option should make the program display the help text
and return directly, not sending a blank notification.

Change-Id: Ifb2f9ede3b64338cba792c6b98a9e9f610fd5a11
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

subject: bluetooth_notification_client: activate GUI notifications
commitMessage:
bluetooth_notification_client: activate GUI notifications

Add a dependency on libwlmessage, which will be used by
blueooth_notification_client to display popup messages
on both Wayland and X11.

dlog some of the error messages.

Change-Id: Ic85de8aad4f20f080c6776ded5dd2237b6364271
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>
Author: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>
Author: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

This new patch set uses the new version of "libwlmessage", which now works on both Wayland and X11. Reworked the code accordingly.

Patch Set 2:

It would be cleaner to use only one log system, either dlog or fprintf.

Patch Set 2: -Verified

Hi Corentin,

I just looked at "fprintf()" calls in bluetooth_notification_client.c. If I am not wrong, they are all printing to "stdout", which means they will be interactive, and not to "stderr" (in which case I could really replace them by dlog "LOGD()" calls). Am I correct, or did I miss something ?
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Change-Id: I40cbfd36281275fd89ab4daf671e406db9fb8a49
Signed-off-by: Stephane Desneux <stephane.desneux@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:

Build OK (with latest platform/core/api/notification).

Patch Set 2:

Anyone to put a +2 and merge ? We're in a hurry for migrating 50 packages and this one is the only one to block the submission to OBS. 

Thanks

Update rquired due to API for notification.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
